channel.title: Lab Rats - QuickTime 720x480
channel.copyright: ℗ & © 2008 ButterScotch.com: a division of Tucows Corporation
channel.description: A fun and educational video cast by Andy Walker and Sean Carruthers about how to use technology you already own. Covers PCs, Macs, all kinds of gadgets and the latest HDTV technology. Includes a healthy dose of humor, a few antics and lots of tech education. Includes cameos of lab cats Biff and Boo.
channel.itunes:author: Andy Walker and Sean Carruthers
channel.itunes:subtitle: Technology made simple, and slight funny.
channel.itunes:summary: A video podcast by Andy Walker and Sean Carruthers about how to use your computers and gadgets and how they work.

item.title: Episode 159: Notebooks? No! Netbooks!
item.description: In episode 159, Andy and Sean take a closeup look at the tiny new phenomenon known as netbooks, explain what they are, and talk about the pros and cons of these ultra-portable devices that are not-quite-notebooks.
item.itunes:author: Andy Walker and Sean Carruthers
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 159: Notebooks? No! Netbooks!
item.itunes:summary: In episode 159, Andy and Sean take a closeup look at the tiny new phenomenon known as netbooks, explain what they are, and talk about the pros and cons of these ultra-portable devices that are not-quite-notebooks.

item.title: Episode 158: The 411 on Windows 7
item.description: In episode 158, Andy and Sean downloaded the beta of Microsoft's next operating system, Windows 7, and give you a tour of some of the new features, as well as some commentary on whether or not it's going to be worth the wait!
item.itunes:author: Andy Walker and Sean Carruthers
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 158: The 411 on Windows 7
item.itunes:summary: In episode 158, Andy and Sean downloaded the beta of Microsoft's next operating system, Windows 7, and give you a tour of some of the new features, as well as some commentary on whether or not it's going to be worth the wait!

item.title: Episode 157: Soccer Mom's Tech Toolbox
item.description: In episode 157, Andy and Sean take a look at some of the techie things every soccer mom--or any mom or dad, for that matter!--should have at their disposal in order to manage their day to day life with kids.

item.title: Episode 156: What IS Windows, anyhow?

item.title: Episode 149: Turn Your Radio On: What is RF?

item.title: Episode 5 - Hard drive upgrades made easy
item.description: In episode 5 (15:12), we show you how to add a hard drive to a PC. Discussion about Serial ATA vs IDE/EIDE and external USB vs Firewire. We suffer a power outage, get interrupted by our pizza guy and enjoy the company of a studio audience that helps out with lighting.

item.title: Episode 4 - Super charge your Windows startup
item.description: In episode 4 (14:54 mins), we show you how to use the hidden "msconfig" program in Windows XP to cut your Windows boot time in half. Plus also use it to remove unwanted programs including spyware from the registry. Biff makes an appearance and messes with the audio. And winter is here in Toronto, so we pull out the tuques.
item.itunes:author: Andy Walker and Sean Carruthers

item.title: Episode 3 - New camcorder features
item.description: In episode 3 (14:56 mins), it camcorder time! But not just any old camcorder. Sean and Andy talk about new camcorder features using cheese and crackers. And, well, the usual mayhem ensues as you would expect with anything that includes cheese. Includes coverage of image stabilization (how it works and which type is better), tape vs. solid state memory cards and CCD (is 1 chip really better than 3?). We even tell you what CCD means. And Danish Havarti is featured. Mmmm.
item.itunes:author: Andy Walker and Sean Carruthers

item.title: Episode 2 - TV connectors demystified
item.description: Andy and Sean turn the TV around and show you what the heck all those weird connectors are for. Includes coverage of coax, component, composite, HDMI, optical, DVI and S-Video! Plus Andy insults cable makers and Sean tries to apologies for him. Biff hangs out. Boo show up for the credits.
item.itunes:author: Andy Walker and Sean Carruthers, Produced by Matt Harris
